description: Main calendar grid widget with multiple view modes, technician pagination, and interactive appointment management

components.CalendarGrid: Comprehensive calendar grid widget supporting multiple view modes with technician pagination and interactive appointment management.

rules: MobX Observer integration for reactive calendar updates when appointment or settings data changes.
Multiple view mode support: day, week, month, agenda with mode-specific rendering strategies.
Technician pagination system with 5 technicians per page to handle large staff teams.
Store hours integration from SettingsStore for dynamic business hour display and scheduling.
Dynamic hour calculation based on store settings with fallback to 8 AM - 8 PM default hours.
Interactive time slot selection with technician assignment for new appointment creation.
Appointment block positioning with precise time-based calculations and visual overlap handling.
Current time line display with red indicator showing real-time progress through the day.
Professional technician headers with avatars, names, and availability status indicators.
Responsive column width calculation based on screen size using CalendarTheme breakpoints.
Scrollable calendar body with synchronized time column for large calendar navigation.
Appointment drag-and-drop support through callback functions for rescheduling operations.
Empty state handling for month and agenda views with 'Coming soon' placeholders.
CalendarTheme integration for consistent colors, dimensions, and styling across components.
Provider pattern for accessing CalendarStore and SettingsStore with proper dependency injection.
Pagination controls in both header and body sections for consistent technician navigation.
Time slot background grid with 15-minute intervals for precise appointment scheduling.
Appointment selection state management with visual feedback through block highlighting.
Memory management with proper ScrollController disposal in widget lifecycle.
Professional UI design with proper spacing, borders, and visual hierarchy for business use.
